column5: 1st time to the area, looking to fish walleye's primarily but want to try lake trout and northern pike also. Any advise as to tactics locations ect. would be greatly appreciated. Have been to dogtooth mid summer but never LOTW. Thanks in advance Scott
Also looking for a good paper map, any suggestions were to order on line? Thanks

http://www.maptown.com/canadiannauti...al-charts.htmlYou will want map numbers 6213 and 6212. A GPS with a map chip is also highly recommended. Most of the area tackle shops, etc sell the paper maps. The chips can be harder to locate so consider buying that in advance if you want one.In the meantime this will wet your appetite: http://lakeofthewoodsmn.com/map.html
on the humps out beyond Yellow Girl point

The 4th of July is a great time to fish sioux narrows. The sunset channel area and yellow girl bay are great for numbers of nice walleye. The best part about that time of year is you can find fish just about anywhere. You can pick your preferred tactic and it will probably work. I like to cast jigs or cranks in the shallows, but you can also catch fish jigging on the humps, or trolling spinners and crawlers. Send me a pm if you would like to discuss specifics.
any advise on trolling for lake trout would be great

Especially if the ice out is by a normal or earlier than normal date the deep water and nearby areas north of the Three Sisters islands incentral/northcentral Whitefish Bay will likely be popular for lake trout. Minnow harnesses with heavy weights are commonly used.
